You’re asking me will my love grow
 I don’t know, I don’t know
 You stick around, now it may show
 I don’t know, I don’t know
He’s struggling to commit, he can’t guarantee that his feelings will develop further. But, if she stays with him, she will see.

Somewhere in her smile she knows
 That I don’t need no other lover
She herself knows that she’s needed by him, as illustrated by her smile.

Something in the way she moves
 Attracts me like no other lover
 Something in the way she woos me

Though other lovers have come before for George, this girl is different.

Who wouldn’t have been attracted to Pattie Boyd like that?



The opening line was taken directly from the title of a James Taylor song.  Taylor was one of the artists signed to Apple Corp.

There was a James Taylor song called “Something In The Way She Moves” which is the first line of that. And so then I thought of trying to change the words, but they were the words that came when I first wrote it, so in the end I just left it as that, and just called it Something.

The song’s lyrics took some time to work out. Lennon advised Harrison to just use whatever popped into his head, resulting in a temporary alternate second line: “attracts me like a cauliflower”.
